mission.description: We're building the world's first verified project portfolio platform where students prove their skills through what they've actually built, not what they claim they can do.

paragraphs.0: InTransparency was born from frustration. Our founders watched talented students with incredible university projects get rejected from jobs because their resumes didn't list "2+ years experience" or a FAANG internship.
paragraphs.1: Meanwhile, companies complained about hiring candidates who looked great on paper but couldn't code. The disconnect was obvious: resumes reward good storytelling, not good building.
paragraphs.2: We asked a simple question: What if students could show their work instead of just listing it? What if recruiters could see verified projects with complete skill analysis (hard + soft), and institution endorsements?

1.q: Is the marketplace really free for institutions?

3.q: How is this better than AlmaLaurea?
3.a: AlmaLaurea charges universities â‚¬2,500/year and just collects self-reported CVs. InTransparency is FREE forever and verifies skills via AI + actual projects. Plus ALL students get exposure (not just those who update their CV), and companies get better data (verified portfolios vs self-reported).

4.q: Do ALL students get exposure or just top performers?
4.a: ALL students. Traditional headhunters only contact the top 5%. We give EVERY student a profile that companies can discover. This dramatically improves placement rates across your entire graduating class, not just the stars.

5.a: Companies browse the entire database for free - unlimited searching, filtering, and AI candidate search. You only pay â‚¬10 when you decide to contact a specific candidate. No subscriptions, no monthly fees, credits never expire.
